meanings.definition: A protein released by cells in response to viruses, helping to inhibit their replication.
meanings.sent1: When a virus attacks, the body produces interferon to fight it off.
meanings.sent2: Doctors use interferon to treat certain viral infections.
meanings.sent3: The interferon protein was like a superhero swooping in to stop the virus invasion.
meanings.sent4: The interferon acted as a shield, protecting the healthy cells from viral harm.
meanings.sent5: The image of interferon battling viruses is etched in my mind.

meanings.definition: To hinder or obstruct the normal process or function of something.
meanings.sent1: Please do not interfere with the experiment process by adding unnecessary steps.
meanings.sent2: The storm will interfere with our plans for the outdoor picnic.
meanings.sent3: His constant questions began to interfere with the flow of the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise from the construction site interfered with her ability to concentrate.
meanings.sent5: The interference of the radio signal made it hard to hear the broadcast clearly.
